cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later Saturday, move along the north coast of Cuba, pass near the Florida Keys Sunday morning, then track up the southwest coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or the southwest coast of Florida (near Naples / Marco Island)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach, and north and west of Anclote River to Indian Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coastline from Boca Raton through Miami including Port Everglades and the Keys; southwest Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected Saturday night with a 47% chance of 50-kt winds and up to a 20% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) gusts Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast, including Port Everglades, if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches possible with isolated totals to 20 inches, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes beginning Saturday midday; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting port approaches
